response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<String> it1 = L1.iterator(); it1.hasNext(); ){
Iterator<String> it2 = L2.iterator();
while(it1.hasNext() || it2.hasNext()){
if(it1.next().compareTo(it2.next()) <= 0){
L3.add(it1.next());
}else{
L3.add(it2.next());
}
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the compareTo() method to compare the elements of the two lists and add the smaller element to the result list. The code above uses a while loop to iterate through both lists and compare their elements. If the current element of the first list is less than or equal to the current element of the second list, it is added to the result list. The loop continues until both lists are exhausted.
